message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DB, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CY 

This paper deals with privacy concerns in location-based systems, which is a topic that falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper proposes a novel metric for achieving privacy in location-based systems, which involves the use of semantic information from OpenStreetMap database, indicating a possible connection to databases (cs.DB). The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques to adapt the level of noise, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also involves the use of spatial information, which falls under the category of spatial information (cs.SI). Finally, the paper involves the use of privacy-preserving techniques, which falls under the category of cryptography (cs.CY).
